result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas James Rinzel

defendant.name: Rinzel, Nicholas James
defendant.address: 10211 West Greenfield Avenue,10, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Nicholas James Rinzel.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, consecutive to count 1 on case 22CF2681, concurrent to count 2 on case 22CF2681.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 30 months with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random UA's.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, 
- No contact with victim, unless changed by agent and only with victim's request.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.  If defendant it revoked on case 22CF2681, pay all mandatory Court costs and all applicable surcharges (including the DV and DNA surcharge) and assessments which are to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Notice Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief

Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Nicholas James Rinzel.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Elements Of The Offense

Plea Questionnaire Waiver Of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Nicholas James Rinzel.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Court will allow transfer of defendant's other case for global resolution.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Nicholas James Rinzel not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defense counsel advises Court that defendant has a new pending case before Judge Crivello.  Court will allow transfer of this case, or will accept other case, for global resolution.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 8-9-22
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (new criminal charges), filed.

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35 via zoom.   Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defense counsel requests an adjournment. Court grants request. Court reschedules case to 6/17/2022 at 8:30 am for status conference. Parties notified.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEW (DOB 10/3/85)

Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Nicholas James Rinzel in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas James Rinzel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.   DEFENDANT MAY NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY DUE TO HIS EMPLOYMENT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
